intro: Gueldenstaedtia guangxiensis, commonly known as Guangxi gueldenstaedtia, is a climbing vine native to southern China. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces lens-shaped pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
